fields.label: initials
fields.tip: Initials: the initials of the person(s) recording the data

fields.label: method
fields.tip: Method and conditions: indicate the tool(s) used and whether the context was excavated after having been exposed to rain.

fields.label: PotteryInterpretation
fields.tip: Comments by pottery specialist for context

fields.label: opening
fields.tip: Slope description on opening: note the degree and direction of the slope on opening

fields.label: closing
fields.tip: Slope description on closing: note the degree and direction of the slope on closing

fields.label: soil chem?
fields.tip: Soil chemistry: has soil chemistry been performed on this context?

fields.label: title
fields.tip: Title: a short and descriptive title

fields.label: sub-type
fields.tip: Sub-type: whether this item is a fill, a deposit, or a grave fill

fields.label: context #
fields.tip: Context number: a numeric context number
Start date: the start date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the context
End date: the end date and time will be automatically filled in when you take the closing points

fields.label: modifier
fields.tip: Colour modifier: the strength of the colour hue

fields.label: hue
fields.tip: Colour hue: the minor colour hue

fields.label: mixed?
fields.tip: Colour mixed: is the context mixed in colour?

fields.label: composit.
fields.tip: Soil composition: use the guide in the manual to determine the soil composition

fields.label: mixed?
fields.tip: Composition mixed: is the context mixed in composition?

fields.label: compaction
fields.tip: Soil compaction: use the table in the manual to determine the soil compaction

fields.label: building %
fields.tip: Inclusions of building stone in percent

fields.label: unworked %
fields.tip: Inclusions of unworked stone (not from building) in percent

fields.label: plaster %
fields.tip: Inclusions of plaster or mortar in percent

fields.label: ceramic %
fields.tip: Inclusions of pottery and ceramics in percent

fields.label: carbon %
fields.tip: Inclusions of carbon, charcoal and ash in percent

fields.label: overall %
fields.tip: Inclusions overall: The overall percentage of inclusions

fields.label: sorting
fields.tip: Sorting of the inclusions: the degree of sorting is a measure of the frequency with which inclusions of the same size occur.

fields.label: unworked
fields.tip: Size of unworked, non-building stone inclusions

fields.label: carbon
fields.tip: Size of carbon, charcoal and ash inclusions

fields.label: in plan
fields.tip: Shape in plan: approximate description of the shape of the context from above

fields.label: difference
fields.tip: Contextual differentiation: What makes this context different from others? For example: ‘this context is blacker and more compact than context 7’ or ‘this context has more frequent and smaller pebble inclusions than 22’

fields.label: boundaries
fields.tip: Boundaries: describe the change between the context you are recording and the context(s) revealed below it

fields.label: equal
fields.tip: Equal contexts: where you have indicated an ‘is equal to’ (ie, same as) relationship, explain here with stratigraphic reasoning why the two contexts should be regarded as the same.

fields.label: contamin.
fields.tip: Contamination: where there is a suspicion that stratigraphic bounds may have been exceeded, make a note here of the extent to which you fear the material and samples of this context may be contaminated by material from another context.

fields.label: context #
fields.tip: Context number: a numeric context number

fields.label: date
fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the cut

fields.label: in plan
fields.tip: Shape in plan: the shape at the top of the cut

fields.label: top slope
fields.tip: Break of slope (top): describe the degree with which the top surface of the edge of the cut breaks into the sides

fields.label: side slope
fields.tip: Side of slope: describe the sides of the cut

fields.label: base slope
fields.tip: Break of slope (base): describe the degree with which the sides break into the base of the cut

fields.label: cut at base
fields.tip: Cut at base: describe the base of the cut
Filled by: list all contexts which were excavated within the volume created by this cut

fields.label: context #
fields.tip: Context number: a numeric context number

fields.label: date
fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the surface

fields.label: in plan
fields.tip: Shape in plan: the shape of the surface from above

fields.label: flatness
fields.tip: Flatness: the flatness (or otherwise) of the surface

fields.label: damage
fields.tip: Damage: describe how the floor has been damaged (e.g. by falling masonry, wear)

fields.label: sub-type
valuelist: built or metalled road or path

fields.label: context #
fields.tip: Context number: a numeric context number

fields.label: date
fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the structure

fields.label: working
fields.tip: Working: indicate to what extent, if any, stones in the wall are worked

fields.label: stone sizes
fields.tip: Stone sizes: approximate average stone size and variation in stone sizes

fields.label: major
fields.tip: Major masonry style: use the diagram in the manual to choose the correct description

fields.label: secondary
fields.tip: Secondary masonry style: record a secondary style if a) the style is different in different parts of the wall or b) none of the styles given is a close enough match and you see a mix of two styles
Extent of exposure: list here which faces, ends and parts are exposed, eg ‘North face, top and west end’

fields.label: ASU #
fields.tip: ASU number: the context number that this ASU belongs to + asterisk + ASU sequence number
Start date: the start date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the ASU
End date: the end date and time will be automatically filled in when you take the closing points

fields.label: find #
fields.tip: Find number: the find number will be automatically assigned when you create the find

fields.label: date
fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the find

fields.label: Class
fields.tip: Indicating of class within the type.

fields.label: number
fields.tip: Sample or bag number: the number will be automatically assigned when you create the item

fields.label: date
fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the find

fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the find

fields.label: Quantity
fields.tip: A count of the individual obsidian pieces.

fields.label: %EndProducts
fields.tip: The percent of overall quantity that is end product.

fields.label: %Cores
fields.tip: The percent of overall quantity that is cores.

fields.label: %ManufacturingDebris
fields.tip: The percent of overall quantity that is manufacturing debris.

fields.label: bone #
fields.tip: Bone number: the bone number has to be manually corrected

fields.label: date
fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the find

fields.label: orient
fields.tip: orientation of bone to cardinal directions: e.g. Distal is north

fields.label: appearance side
fields.tip: which aspect of bone is top surface

fields.label: Joins?
fields.tip: Yes for join, No for possibly same vessel

fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the find

fields.label: photo #
fields.tip: Photo number: the photo number will be automatically assigned when you create the photo

fields.label: number
fields.tip: Topo point number: enter the code number for this series of points

fields.label: photo #
fields.tip: Photo number: the photo number will be automatically assigned when you create the photo

fields.label: date
fields.tip: Date: the date and time will be automatically filled in when you create the find

fields.label: sequence #
fields.tip: Sequence number: the sequence number will be automatically assigned when you create a photo

fields.label: filenames
fields.tip: Filenames: give the camera identifier, and the range of photos, eg ‘F 1020655-1020660’. It is important to give the camera identifier as otherwise the photo numbers will be duplicated with other cameras.
